Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Customer
  • public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
    Customer Class

    Initializes a customer object and manages their buying history and identification information Allows customers to add, remove, and purchase items in a cart

    Version:
    November 11, 2023
    Author:
    Lalitha Chandolu, Nirmal Senthilkumar; CS 180 Black

      • viewShoppingHistory

        public static java.lang.String viewShoppingHistory​(java.lang.String userName,
                                                   java.lang.String sortBy,
                                                   boolean ASCENDING)
        Output a string of the purchases made by the customer
        Parameters:
        userName - the username of the customer
        sortBy - the value to sort by, valid values are "price" (the amount of total money) or "quantity"
        ASCENDING - choose to sort the values by sortBy in ascending or descending order
        Returns:
        a formmated String that has the list of products sorted by the specified sortBy and ASCENDING parameters, returns "Your purchase history is empty" if there is no purchase history

        Parameters:

        storeName - name of store product is from
        quantity - quantity of product
        customerName - lient name of
        Returns:
        true if it was added, false if it could not be added

        removes a product from the cart
        Parameters:

      • buyShoppingCartItems

        public static java.lang.String buyShoppingCartItems​(java.lang.String customerName)

        Parameters:
        customerName - the customer checking out
        Returns:
        String of cart (products being checked out and moved from shoppingCart to purchases)
